why: Data scientist with the Risk and Analytics team focused on providing data products and consultation to all BUs in the company to facilitate their work. Gathering requirements and developing a variety of automated reports, self-service interactive tools, and data request desk.

Maintain, manage, and developed Paidy's first internal interactive data tooling suite using R and Shiny. Coordinated with other BUs to gather and clarify on-going requirements and quickly deploying new data views.

Drive internal automation and process efficiency improvements by understanding the needs of co-workers and quickly developing automated reports or connecting services reducing manual labor on a number of processes in sales, finance,

Designed, built, and manage the company's internal data request help desk that delivers over 50 insight and operational data reports to all BUs in the company every month. Setup an agent rotation system to spread workload and knowledge across the analytics team.
Participated in a variety of company-wide initiatives including driving the company's move to data-driven product design, financial reporting standardization, and HR liaison and health-committee.
Planned, created, and ran English lessons for Junior High School students at a public school in Yokohama. Collaborated with local teachers to develop materials and lesson plans on a weekly basis.

Built an SVM-based outlier detection model for smart electrical grid data included in the SPARKS PoC analytics dashboard. Reduced the computation time tenfold while enhancing the look-and-feel of the user interface.

Created a detector to identify clusters of dead sensors in the first 2 months of learning the R language. Self-learnt spatial analysis skills to create a preliminary data product for the HSE based on ambulance trajectory data. Leveraged ML clustering techniques to parse the data into individual journeys.

Headed the streamlining of the in-house expense and time reporting efforts through the development of custom web-applications. Administered and maintained the groups git code repositories and intranet.
Developed C++ and python analysis applications to search for theoretical particles in millions of data points collected by the ATLAS experiment at CERN.

Implemented and maintained two data analysis projects using C++ and python to search for new particles, and estimates the performance of data classification algorithms. Streamlined the analysis scheme used by the team based on the results of these projects. The results were presented to other expert teams at CERN.
Implemented a search for the Higgs boson in terabytes of simulated data using C++ and the CERN analysis framework ROOT. Optimised the analysis scheme to increase the number of Higgs events detected.
Authored slides to communicate project progress and results to team members and other experts not directly involved in the analysis.
Collaborated with supervisors and colleagues to resolve issues and iterate on the analysis plan.

Programmed software to collect and analyze laser profile data, as part of the R&D a laser-wire system, using C++ and LabView. Self-taught both languages and produce preliminary results within a month.
